New Records: Aaron Jones set a new USA record for the fastest half-century in T20 internationals, reaching it in just 22 balls.
Key Match Events: Aaron Jones played a monumental unbeaten 94 from only 40 balls, hitting 10 sixes.
USA won by seven wickets, chasing down a target of 195.
Nikhil Dutta's first over changed the momentum of the game, allowing USA to score 33 runs in one over.
Aaron Jones reverse-swept Dutta for four and then slog-swept two sixes to finish the game.
Canada's Shreyas Movva scored a quick-fire 32 not out from only 16 balls.
Corey Anderson took a crucial wicket of Navneet Dhaliwal, who scored 61 runs.
Canada's Nicholas Kirton scored a stylish fifty from only 28 balls.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Jones expressed his happiness in getting his team over the line and mentioned the rivalry with Canada.
Jones emphasized the importance of aggressive cricket and his role in power-hitting.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium in Dallas, Texas.
USA celebrated their T20 World Cup debut with a stirring victory over Canada.
